author: Staff Reporter
text:
In the ongoing plagiarism case against the Rajinikanth-starrer Lingaa movie, K.R. Ravi Rathinam, who filed the case, on Monday requested the court to form an advocates’ commission to scrutinize the movie script.

The makers on Monday submitted the original script at the Additional District Munsif Court in Madurai as ordered earlier.

When the case came up for hearing, the counsel of Mr. Ravi Rathinam filed a petition requesting the formation of the commission. It was requested that the commission should compare the script of Lingaa and ‘Mullai Vanam 999,’ the movie Mr. Ravi Rathinam was planning to make, and from which Lingaa was allegedly copied. Judge N. Vishwanath adjourned the case to Tuesday. The Madurai Bench of Madras High Court ordered the case be disposed by April-end.
title: Lingaa case: advocates’ commission sought
